application

Class ArrowButton<E extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.ArrowButton<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the data type the button can store
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ArrowButton<E extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A button resembling a triangle with a square at one end. It can be oriented either up or down and the color of the square can be changed. It can store and return a data type. It waS built specifically for use in the gradient editor and is not fit for other use.
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean isDown()
        returns whether or not the button points downwards. If false, the button points upwards

      • setDown

        public void setDown(boolean down)
        Sets the new value for down. If true, the button will point down. If false, the button will point up.
        Parameters:
        down - the new value for down. If true, the button will point down. If false, the button will point up.

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        takes in the new x value of the button. This value is how the palette keeps track of which order all the buttons are in. This value does NOT represent the x location of the button on the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x value of the button. This value is how the palette keeps track of which order all the buttons are in. This value does NOT represent the x location of the button on the screen.

      • getX

        Returns:
